issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
This manifests when the system runs 100 ELBs and 200 ELB VMs. Each VM keeps trying contact CLC in every 10 seconds. I suspect this maybe related to DNS queries that arrive before services are enabled. When it manifests It takes much longer (<5 min) for all services to be ENABLED.

fields.summary: When overloaded CLC restarts, log is filled with transaction errors

comments.body: [~spark], the fix looks good to me.
[~spark], so to verify this, would I just need to have near max # of ELBs running then restart the CLC? Thanks.
[~tony] Yes. I think with the default property and 1 VM per ELB, it would need > 200 ELBs to reproduce. This one manifests on UFS host.

Fix Verified.

Verified on the scale system which was built from source on 10/08/2015.

Test done:
# created 200 ELBs
# Restarted eucalyptus-cloud service
# Did not observe the reported error in cloud-out log with log level set to DEBUG on clc or UFSs
